title.rendered: Indie Store itch.io on NTFs: “They’re a Scam”

content.rendered:
itch.io doesn’t like non-fungible tokens, better known as NFTs. These products powered by blockchain technology have become one of the points of interest for companies, which see a business opportunity. At the same time, many players have raised their eyebrows, as some consider it a scam. That is precisely the expression you used. the store specializing in indie titles.

At the insistence of users on the position of itch.io before the NFTsthe company has published an unequivocal statement on social networks to clarify its vision in this regard.

“NFTs are a scam. If you think they are legitimately useful for something other than exploitation of its creators, the financial scams and the destruction of the planet, we ask you to reevaluate your choices in life. Also, fuck the companies that say they support creators and approve of NFTs anyway. They only care about their own benefit and the opportunity to generate wealth over others.”

Also f̸̗̎ú̴̩c̷̖͌ḳ̵̀ any company that says they support creators and also endorses NFTs in any way. They only care about their own profit and the opportunity for wealth above anyone else.

Especially given the now easily available discourse concerning the problems of NFTs.

— itch.io (@itchio) February 6, 2022

Konami and Ubisoft will continue betting on NFTs

Konami’s experiment with Castlevania NFTs has gone well for them. The success of sales of some articles related to the 35th anniversary of the saga has reaffirmed this position: “We will also sell NFT in an attempt to preserve the content that our consumers have loved as commemorative art.” raised more than €140,000 at auction of 14 items from the collection.

Ubisoft, for its part, has had more problems, since the response from users has been relatively vehement. In the French firm they trust that in the future they will be able to explain more adequately what is the utility and supposed benefits that players will enjoy with Ubisoft Quartz.
